name: menhir
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a tall stone put in a vertical position by people in prehistoric times (= the period before there were written records): The countryside is dotted with Neolithic menhirs. Synonym
standing stone
jopelka/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examples According to local legend the menhirs were Roman soldiers turned to stone by a druid. The site at Le Ménec has 1,099 menhirs in 12 rows. There are two giant menhirs close by, one of them covered with symbolic engravings.Menhirs are tall standing stones that archaeologists often ascribe to fertility cults.
